[33m# Deep Learning with Python and Keras: Build a Model For Sentiment Analysis[0m
[33m## Introduction[0m
[33m        [0m[33mAn overview of sentiment analysis       [0m[1;33m287[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn what sentiment analysis is all about.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mPrerequisites   [0m[1;33m54[0m[33m      [0m[33mIn this video, learn what prerequisites you need to have to be able to make the most of this course.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m1[0m[33m. Overview of Sentiment Analysis[0m
[33m        [0m[33mPreprocessing text for sentiment analysis       [0m[1;33m170[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, discover the kinds of preprocessing that you apply to [0m
[33mtext for sentiment analysis.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWord vector encodings and word embeddings       [0m[1;33m371[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how words can be represented in numeric form.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mTypes of sentiment analysis     [0m[1;33m221[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn the different kinds of sentiment analysis that you can perform [0m
[33mand when you would choose to use them.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mApproaches and challenges in sentiment analysis [0m[1;33m350[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn about the various approaches to sentiment [0m
[33manalysis and the challenges that you might face.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m2[0m[33m. Cleaning and Preprocessing Text Data[0m
[33m        [0m[33mGetting set up with Google Colab        [0m[1;33m225[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to set up your environment to train deep learning [0m
[33mmodels on Google Colab.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mImporting Python modules and loading data       [0m[1;33m236[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to import the libraries that you need and [0m
[33mload your data for training.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mAnalyzing word lengths across sentiment categories      [0m[1;33m257[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn techniques that you can use to analyze [0m
[33mtext using word lengths.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mCleaning and preprocessing text [0m[1;33m373[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to implement data cleaning using regular expressions.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mVisualizing text using word clouds      [0m[1;33m105[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to use the word cloud visualization to understand [0m
[33myour data.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m3[0m[33m. Sentiment Analysis Using Dense Neural Networks[0m
[33m        [0m[33mFeed-forward neural networks    [0m[1;33m271[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to recall the drawbacks of feed-forward networks in working [0m
[33mwith sequential data.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mSplitting data into training test and validation sets   [0m[1;33m226[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to split your data for training, [0m
[33mvalidation, and testing.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mRepresenting text using count vectorization     [0m[1;33m471[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to use Keras and TensorFlow to encode text [0m
[33musing count vectors.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mConfiguring the dense neural network [0m[1;33m([0m[33mDNN[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m      [0m[1;33m315[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to configure a dense neural network [0m
[33marchitecture in TensorFlow and Keras.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mTraining and evaluating the DNN [0m[1;33m193[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to train and evaluate a dense neural network.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mConfiguring the count vectorizer as a model layer       [0m[1;33m153[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to include the count vectorization [0m
[33mlayer as a model layer.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mRepresenting text using TFIDF vectorization     [0m[1;33m309[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to use Keras and TensorFlow to encode text [0m
[33musing tf-idf vectors.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mTraining and evaluating the model       [0m[1;33m200[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to train and evaluate a dense neural network in Keras[0m
[33mand TensorFlow.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mRepresenting text using integer sequences       [0m[1;33m188[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to represent the input text using integer [0m
[33msequences in order to generate embeddings.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mTraining ADNN using embeddings  [0m[1;33m434[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to train a dense neural network with an embedding layer.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m4[0m[33m. Sentiment Analysis Using Recurrent Neural Networks[0m
[33m        [0m[33mRecurrent neural networks       [0m[1;33m253[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how recurrent neural networks work.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mLong memory cells       [0m[1;33m309[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn the importance of long memory cells in RNNs.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mThe LSTM and GRU cells  [0m[1;33m224[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, gain a big-picture understanding of how LSTM and GRU cells work.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mTraining a recurrent neural network     [0m[1;33m221[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to train a recurrent neural network.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mTraining an LSTM network        [0m[1;33m189[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to train an RNN with LSTM cells.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mSerializing a model to disk and loading the model       [0m[1;33m212[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to serialize a trained model to disk [0m
[33mand load it from disk for predictions.[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36massistant:[0m
[34m# Review of Deep Learning with Python Professional Certificate Curriculum[0m

[34m## [0m[1;34m1[0m[34m. Overall Assessment[0m

[34mThe [0m[34m"Deep Learning with Python Professional Certificate by Anaconda"[0m[34m curriculum provides a reasonably structured introduction to deep [0m
[34mlearning for people with some Python experience and minimal machine learning background. The curriculum progresses logically from [0m
[34mneural network foundations to implementation, optimization, and a practical application. While the progression is sound, there are [0m
[34msome gaps in prerequisite knowledge and practical implementation specifics that could be addressed to better serve the target [0m
[34maudience.[0m

[34m## [0m[1;34m2[0m[34m. Detailed Analysis[0m

[34m### a. Topic Coverage[0m

[34mThe curriculum covers several key areas of deep learning:[0m
[34m- Fundamentals of neural networks [0m[1;34m([0m[34marchitectures, components, use cases[0m[1;34m)[0m
[34m- Building and training neural networks with Keras[0m
[34m- Optimization techniques [0m[1;34m([0m[34mdata preprocessing, regularization, hyperparameter tuning[0m[1;34m)[0m
[34m- Practical application through sentiment analysis with RNNs[0m

[34mThe coverage is reasonably comprehensive for an introduction to deep learning, particularly with the inclusion of both theory [0m[1;34m([0m[34mfirst [0m
[34mcourse[0m[1;34m)[0m[34m and practical implementation [0m[1;34m([0m[34msubsequent courses[0m[1;34m)[0m[34m. The final course on sentiment analysis provides a concrete application that[0m
[34mhelps solidify learning.[0m

[34m### b. Prerequisite and Difficulty Scaffolding[0m

[34m**Strengths:**[0m
[34m- The curriculum begins with foundational neural network concepts before moving to implementation[0m
[34m- There is clear progression from basic implementation to optimization techniques[0m
[34m- The final course applies the knowledge to a specific use case[0m

[34m**Weaknesses:**[0m
[34m- Given the audience has [0m[34m"very small amount of background in machine learning,"[0m[34m there may be insufficient coverage of basic machine [0m
[34mlearning concepts that underpin deep learning[0m
[34m- The jump from the first course [0m[1;34m([0m[34mtheory-focused[0m[1;34m)[0m[34m to the second course [0m[1;34m([0m[34mimplementation[0m[1;34m)[0m[34m might be steep for those with minimal machine [0m
[34mlearning experience[0m
[34m- The curriculum assumes some knowledge of model evaluation and metrics without explicitly covering these topics[0m

[34m### c. Course Relevance and Fit[0m

[34mAll courses are relevant to the topic of deep learning with Python:[0m
[34m- The first course offers conceptual foundations necessary for understanding neural networks[0m
[34m- The second and third courses focus on practical implementation and optimization using Python[0m
[34m- The fourth course applies learning to a specific use case [0m[1;34m([0m[34msentiment analysis[0m[1;34m)[0m

[34mThe fit for the audience is generally appropriate, though the transition between conceptual understanding and implementation might [0m
[34mneed additional support given the limited machine learning background of the audience.[0m

[34m### d. Content Redundancy[0m

[34mThere appears to be minimal harmful redundancy in the curriculum. Some overlap exists between:[0m
[34m- Neural network basics in the first and second courses, which is likely intentional reinforcement[0m
[34m- Optimization topics that may appear in both the second and third courses[0m

[34mThis overlap is likely beneficial for the intended audience as it reinforces key concepts.[0m

[34m### e. Identified Gaps or Missing Topics[0m

[34mSeveral important gaps exist:[0m
[1;34m1[0m[34m. **Foundational machine learning concepts**: Given the audience's limited background, a preliminary course on basic machine learning[0m
[34mconcepts would be valuable[0m
[1;34m2[0m[34m. **Data preparation**: While mentioned in optimization, dedicated coverage of data preparation for deep learning is needed[0m
[1;34m3[0m[34m. **Model evaluation**: More explicit coverage of how to evaluate deep learning models[0m
[1;34m4[0m[34m. **Deployment considerations**: No content on deploying trained models in production[0m
[1;34m5[0m[34m. **Deep learning ethics**: No explicit coverage of ethical considerations in deep learning applications[0m
[1;34m6[0m[34m. **Computer vision applications**: The curriculum focuses on text [0m[1;34m([0m[34msentiment analysis[0m[1;34m)[0m[34m but lacks coverage of image-based [0m
[34mapplications[0m

[34m## [0m[1;34m3[0m[34m. Recommendations[0m

[34m### Course Additions[0m
[1;34m1[0m[34m. Add a preliminary course: [0m[34m"Introduction to Machine Learning Concepts for Deep Learning"[0m[34m covering basic concepts like training/test [0m
[34msplits, overfitting, and evaluation metrics[0m
[1;34m2[0m[34m. Add a course on computer vision applications with CNNs to balance the text-focused sentiment analysis course[0m
[1;34m3[0m[34m. Add a brief module on model deployment and deep learning ethics[0m

[34m### Course Modifications[0m
[1;34m1[0m[34m. Expand the second course [0m[1;34m([0m[34m"Deep Learning with Python: Foundations"[0m[1;34m)[0m[34m to include more gradual scaffolding from basic machine learning[0m
[34mto deep learning[0m
[1;34m2[0m[34m. Add specific sections on data preparation and model evaluation in the optimization course[0m
[1;34m3[0m[34m. Include more explicit connections between theoretical concepts in the first course and their implementation in subsequent courses[0m

[34m### Curriculum Reordering[0m
[34mThe current order is logical, but I would recommend:[0m
[1;34m1[0m[34m. [0m[1;34m[[0m[34mNEW[0m[1;34m][0m[34m Introduction to Machine Learning Concepts for Deep Learning[0m
[1;34m2[0m[34m. Artificial Intelligence Foundations: Neural Networks[0m
[1;34m3[0m[34m. Deep Learning with Python: Foundations[0m
[1;34m4[0m[34m. Deep Learning with Python: Optimizing Deep Learning Models[0m
[1;34m5[0m[34m. Deep Learning with Python and Keras: Build a Model For Sentiment Analysis[0m
[1;34m6[0m[34m. [0m[1;34m[[0m[34mNEW[0m[1;34m][0m[34m Building Computer Vision Applications with Convolutional Neural Networks[0m
[1;34m7[0m[34m. [0m[1;34m[[0m[34mNEW[0m[1;34m][0m[34m Deploying Deep Learning Models and Ethical Considerations[0m

[34mThese adjustments would better accommodate the audience's limited machine learning background while providing a more comprehensive [0m
[34mintroduction to deep learning with Python.[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36muser:[0m
[33mHere's a curriculum to analyze:[0m

[1;33m<[0m[1;33mcourse[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>[0m
[33mArtificial Intelligence Foundations: Machine Learning[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<description>[0m
[33mMachine learning is the most exciting branch of artificial intelligence. It allows systems to learn from data by identifying patterns [0m
[33mand making decisions with little to no human intervention. In this course, you'll navigate the machine learning lifecycle by getting [0m
[33mhands-on practice training your first machine learning model. Join instructor Kesha Williams as she explores widely adopted machine [0m
[33mlearning methods: supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement. There's a focus on sourcing and preparing data and selecting the best [0m
[33mlearning algorithm for your project. After training a model, learn to evaluate model performance using standard metrics. Finally, [0m
[33mKesha shows you how to streamline the process by building a machine learning pipeline. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re looking to understand the machine [0m
[33mlearning lifecycle and the steps required to build systems, check out this course.[0m

[33m## [0m[1;33m2[0m[33m. Implementing a Machine Learning Solution[0m

[33msystems.[0m

[33mproblems to determine if machine learning is appropriate. When you understand how to frame machine learning problems, you'll be [0m
[33mprepared to implement a machine learning solution.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mIdentifying a pre-built model   [0m[1;33m232[0m[33m     [0m[33mAfter watching this video, you will understand the benefit of exploring pre-built [0m
[33mmodels on the market. When you understand the pre-built models available, you'll be able to implement solutions faster.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mUnderstanding tools used to train a model       [0m[1;33m258[0m[33m     [0m[33mAfter watching this video, you will understand the tools needed to [0m
[33mtrain a custom model when pre-built models don't fit your needs. When you understand the tools needed to train a custom model, you'll [0m
[33mmake better implementation decisions.[0m

[33m<description>[0m
[33m&lt;p&gt;YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve probably heard about machine learning before, but have you ever wondered what that term really means? How does a [0m
[33mmachine learn? Have you thought about building a machine learning model, but didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know where to start?&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;In this [0m
[33mcourse, Frederick Nwanganga introduces machine learning in an approachable way and provides step-by-step guidance on how to get [0m
[33mstarted with machine learning via the most in-demand language in use today, Python. Frederick starts with exactly what it means for [0m
[33mmachines to learn and the different ways they learn, then gets into how to collect, understand, and prepare data for machine learning.[0m
[33mHe also provides guided examples of how to accomplish each step using Python. Finally, he brings it all together to build, evaluate, [0m
[33mand interpret the results of a machine learning model in Python.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mdescription[0m[33m>[0m

[33m# Machine Learning with Python: Foundations[0m
[33m## Introduction[0m
[33m        [0m[33mMachine learning in our world   [0m[1;33m48[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat you should know    [0m[1;33m45[0m
[33m        [0m[33mThe tools you need      [0m[1;33m62[0m
[33m        [0m[33mUsing the exercise files        [0m[1;33m78[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m1[0m[33m. Machine Learning[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is machine learning?       [0m[1;33m239[0m[33m     [0m[33mThe term [0m[33m"machine learning"[0m[33m is often used but seldom understood. In this video, learn [0m
[33mwhat machine learning is and how the term came to be.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is not machine learning?   [0m[1;33m374[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is unsupervised learning?  [0m[1;33m159[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn the basic idea behind unsupervised machine learning, an approach [0m
[33mused to identify and group patterns in data. Also, learn how machine learning is used when working with unlabeled data.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is supervised learning?    [0m[1;33m245[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn the basic idea behind supervised machine learning, the approach [0m
[33mused to predict future outcomes based on prior history. Also, learn how machine learning is used when working with previously labeled [0m
[33mdata.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is reinforcement learning? [0m[1;33m366[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn the basic idea behind reinforcement learning, an approach to [0m
[33mmachine learning used when trying to build a model that is rewards based. Also, learn how reinforcement learning differs from the [0m
[33mother two common machine learning approaches and when it is appropriate to use a reinforcement learning approach.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat are the steps to machine learning? [0m[1;33m313[0m[33m     [0m[33mThere are six stages or steps to the machine learning process. In this video, [0m
[33mlearn these steps and why they are important.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m2[0m[33m. Collecting Data for Machine Learning[0m
[33m        [0m[33mThings to consider when collecting data [0m[1;33m228[0m[33m     [0m[33mBefore you collect data for machine learning, you need to carefully consider [0m
[33mwhat type of data you need and how the data will be used. In this video, learn five key considerations you should be aware of with [0m
[33mregard to the data collected for machine learning.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to import data in Python    [0m[1;33m303[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn what pandas.Series and pandas.DataFrame objects are, as well as [0m
[33mhow to import data from both a CSV and Excel file into a DataFrame in Python.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m3[0m[33m. Understanding Data for Machine Learning[0m
[33m        [0m[33mDescribe your data      [0m[1;33m213[0m[33m     [0m[33mA key part of data exploration is describing data. In this video, explore the key terms used [0m
[33mto describe the nature and structure of data in machine learning.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to summarize data in Python [0m[1;33m360[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to calculate both simple and group-level descriptive [0m
[33mstatistics in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mVisualize your data     [0m[1;33m222[0m[33m     [0m[33mA key part of data exploration is visualizing data. In this video, discover which [0m
[33mvisualizations best answer certain types of questions about your data.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to visualize data in Python [0m[1;33m383[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to create descriptive visualizations against your data in [0m
[33mPython.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m4[0m[33m. Preparing Data for Machine Learning[0m
[33m        [0m[33mCommon data quality issues      [0m[1;33m222[0m[33m     [0m[33mIt is not uncommon to have to deal with data quality issues prior to machine learning.[0m
[33mIn this video, learn some of the most common quality issues that occur with data and how they are usually dealt with.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to resolve missing data in Python   [0m[1;33m454[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to detect, remove, and resolve missing data with [0m
[33mPython.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mNormalizing your data   [0m[1;33m279[0m[33m     [0m[33mA key part of data preparation is transforming the structure of your data. In fact, some [0m
[33mmachine learning approaches require this. In this video, learn how some of the most common normalization techniques work.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to normalize data in Python [0m[1;33m278[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to normalize, discretize, and dummy code data with Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mSampling your data      [0m[1;33m247[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn order to build a machine learning model, you need to create representative samples of the [0m
[33mdata for the training and test datasets. There are several ways to do this. In this video, learn the difference between several of the[0m
[33mmost commonly used sampling techniques.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to sample data in Python    [0m[1;33m395[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to sample data using different techniques in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mReducing the dimensionality of your data        [0m[1;33m204[0m[33m     [0m[33mA key part of data preparation is reducing the dimensionality of your [0m
[33mdata. In this video, learn what dimensionality is, why it is important, and two of the major approaches to dimensionality reduction.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m5[0m[33m. Types of Machine Learning Models[0m
[33m        [0m[33mClassification vs. regression problems  [0m[1;33m195[0m[33m     [0m[33mDepending on the type of value you intend to predict, supervised machine [0m
[33mlearning models are either referred to as classification models or regression models. In this video, learn how classification differs [0m
[33mfrom regression and how to evaluate the performance of both types of models.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to build a machine learning model in Python [0m[1;33m355[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to collect, explore, and prepare data prior [0m
[33mto building and evaluating a supervised machine learning model in Python.[0m

[1;33m<[0m[1;33mcourse[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>[0m
[33mMachine Learning with Python: Decision Trees[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<description>[0m
[33mDecision trees are one of the most common approaches used in supervised machine learning. Building a decision tree allows you to model[0m
[33mcomplex relationships between variables by mimicking if-then-else decision-making as a naturally occurring human behavior. In this [0m
[33mcourse, instructor Frederick Nwanganga gives you an overview of how to collect, explore, and transform your data in preparation for [0m
[33mbuilding decision tree models in Python.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Discover the power of decision trees, what they are, how they are built, [0m
[33mand how they quantify impurity within a partition. Get tips from Frederick on building, visualizing, pruning, and using a decision [0m
[33mtree in Python including classification trees and regression trees. By the end of this course, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be ready to start making your [0m
[33mown models and applying them to different domains.[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mdescription[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<toc>[0m
[33m# Machine Learning with Python: Decision Trees[0m
[33m## Introduction[0m
[33m        [0m[33mMaking decisions with Python    [0m[1;33m51[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat you should know    [0m[1;33m70[0m
[33m        [0m[33mThe tools you need      [0m[1;33m75[0m
[33m        [0m[33mUsing the exercise files        [0m[1;33m106[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m1[0m[33m. Decision Trees[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is a decision tree?        [0m[1;33m269[0m[33m     [0m[33mDecision trees help you predict an outcome based on the responses to a series of [0m
[33mquestions. In this video, learn what decision trees are and how useful they are in solving classification and regression machine [0m
[33mlearning problems.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow is a classification tree built?     [0m[1;33m387[0m[33m     [0m[33mDecision trees are built using a process known as recursive partitioning. In [0m
[33mthis video, learn how the recursive partitioning process is used to build a classification tree.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow do classification trees measure impurity?   [0m[1;33m348[0m[33m     [0m[33mThe primary objective of recursive partitioning is to reduce the [0m
[33mimpurity within each partition. In this video, learn about the different ways in which decision tree algorithms quantify impurity [0m
[33mwithin a partition.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow is a regression tree built? [0m[1;33m340[0m[33m     [0m[33mDecision trees are built using a process known as recursive partitioning. In this [0m
[33mvideo, learn how the recursive partitioning process is used to build a regression tree.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to prune a decision tree    [0m[1;33m430[0m[33m     [0m[33mLeft unchecked, decision trees can grow very large and overfit against the data. In [0m
[33mthis video, learn how to properly manage the size of a decision tree using a process known as pruning.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhy and when to use a decision tree     [0m[1;33m179[0m[33m     [0m[33mDecision trees are one of the most popular machine learning algorithms and are[0m
[33moften used to solve a wide variety of problems. In this video, learn about the types of problems that can be solved using decision [0m
[33mtrees.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m2[0m[33m. Working with Classification Trees[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to build a classification tree in Python    [0m[1;33m365[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to build a classification tree in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to visualize a classification tree in Python        [0m[1;33m258[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to visualize and interpret the nodes [0m
[33mof a classification tree in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to prune a classification tree in Python    [0m[1;33m309[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to pre-prune a classification tree in Python [0m
[33mby adjusting the parameters of the tree. Pruning allows you to optimize the size of a decision tree to avoid underfitting and [0m
[33moverfitting.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m3[0m[33m. Working with Regression Trees[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to build a regression tree in Python        [0m[1;33m470[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to build a regression tree in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to visualize a regression tree in Python    [0m[1;33m326[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to visualize and interpret the nodes of a [0m
[33mregression tree in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to prune a regression tree in Python        [0m[1;33m347[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to post-prune a regression tree in Python [0m
[33musing cost-complexity pruning. Pruning allows you to optimize the size of a decision tree to avoid underfitting and overfitting.[0m
[33m## Conclusion[0m
[33m        [0m[33mNext steps with decision trees  [0m[1;33m103[0m
[33m        [0m[33mFAKE VIDEO FOR ARTICLE  [0m[1;33m0[0m
[33m        [0m[33mNext in this series     [0m[1;33m30[0m

[33mMachine Learning with Python: Logistic Regression[0m

[33m<description>[0m
[33mAre you looking for a practical way to use machine learning to solve complex real-world problems? Logistic regression is an approach [0m
[33mto supervised machine learning that models selected values to predict possible outcomes. In this course, Notre Dame professor [0m
[33mFrederick Nwanganga provides you with a step-by-step guide on how to build a logistic regression model using Python. Learn hands-on [0m
[33mtips for collecting, exploring, and transforming your data before you even get started. By the end of this course, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll have the [0m
[33mtechnical skills to know when and how to design, build, evaluate, and effectively manage a logistic regression model all on your [0m
[33mown.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;This course is integrated with GitHub Codespaces, an instant cloud developer environment that offers all the [0m
[33mfunctionality of your favorite IDE without the need for any local machine setup. With GitHub Codespaces, you can get hands-on practice[0m
[33mfrom any machine, at any timeÃ¢â‚¬â€all while using a tool that youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll likely encounter in the workplace. Check out the Ã¢â‚¬Å“Using GitHub [0m
[33mCodespaces with this courseÃ¢â‚¬Â video to learn how to get started.[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mdescription[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<toc>[0m
[33m# Machine Learning with Python: Logistic Regression[0m
[33m## Introduction[0m
[33m        [0m[33mClassifying data with logistic regression       [0m[1;33m68[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat you should know    [0m[1;33m76[0m
[33m        [0m[33mUsing the exercise files        [0m[1;33m98[0m
[33m        [0m[33mUsing GitHub Codespaces with this course        [0m[1;33m361[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m1[0m[33m. Regression[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is regression?     [0m[1;33m217[0m[33m     [0m[33mRegression analysis refers to a family of machine learning models that allow you to model the [0m
[33msize and strength of numerical relationships. In this video, gain a basic understanding of what regression analysis is.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mThe anatomy of a regression model       [0m[1;33m258[0m[33m     [0m[33mThe anatomy of a regression model consists of three components. In this video,[0m
[33mdiscover what these components are and what role they play in the estimation of a regression function.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mCommon types of regression      [0m[1;33m352[0m[33m     [0m[33mDepending on the nature of your data and the type of value you want to predict, you [0m
[33mcan use one of several forms of regression. In this video, explore the difference between four common types of regression and when to [0m
[33muse them.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m2[0m[33m. Logistic Regression[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is logistic regression?    [0m[1;33m331[0m[33m     [0m[33mLogistic regression is a supervised machine learning technique that models the [0m
[33mrelationship between one or more predictors and the probability of a categorical response. In this video, gain a fundamental [0m
[33munderstanding of how logistic regression works.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mMaking predictions with logistic regression     [0m[1;33m303[0m[33m     [0m[33mLogistic regression models predict the probability of a categorical [0m
[33mresponse given a set of predictor values. However, they start off by estimating the log odds of an event. In this video, learn how [0m
[33mlogistic regression models make the journey from log odds, to odds and then to probability.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mInterpreting the coefficients of logistic regression    [0m[1;33m460[0m[33m     [0m[33mLogistic regression models predict the probability of a [0m
[33mcategorical response given a set of predictor values. However, instead of simply predicting an outcome, you sometimes want to [0m
[33munderstand the quantitative impact that a unit change in X has on Y. In this video, learn how to interpret the coefficients of a [0m
[33mlogistic regression model for both categorical and continuous predictor variables.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhy and when to use logistic regression [0m[1;33m111[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, get familiar with the strengths and weaknesses of logistic [0m
[33mregression models and when best to use them.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m3[0m[33m. Classifying Data with Logistic Regression[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to explore data for logistic regression in Python   [0m[1;33m712[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to import data and perform [0m
[33mexploratory data analysis in preparation for logistic regression in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to prepare data for logistic regression in Python   [0m[1;33m374[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to split data into training and test [0m
[33msets prior to training a logistic regression model in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to build a logistic regression model in Python      [0m[1;33m332[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to train a logistic regression model [0m
[33min Python and how to evaluate the modelâ€™s performance against a test dataset.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to interpret a logistic regression model in Python  [0m[1;33m511[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to interpret the coefficients of a [0m
[33mlogistic regression model in Python.[0m
[33m## Conclusion[0m

[1;33m<[0m[1;33mcourse[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>[0m
[33mMachine Learning with Python: k-Means Clustering[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<description>[0m
[33mClusteringÃ¢â‚¬â€an unsupervised machine learning approach used to group data based on similarityÃ¢â‚¬â€is used for work in network analysis, [0m
[33mmarket segmentation, search results grouping, medical imaging, and anomaly detection. K-means clustering is one of the most popular [0m
[33mand easy to use clustering algorithms. In this course, Fred Nwanganga gives you an introductory look at k-means clusteringÃ¢â‚¬â€how it [0m
[33mworks, what itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s good for, when you should use it, how to choose the right number of clusters, its strengths and weaknesses, and [0m
[33mmore. Fred provides hands-on guidance on how to collect, explore, and transform data in preparation for segmenting data using k-means [0m
[33mclustering, and gives a step-by-step guide on how to build such a model in Python.[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mdescription[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<toc>[0m
[33m# Machine Learning with Python: k-Means Clustering[0m
[33m## Introduction[0m
[33m        [0m[33mGetting started with Python and k-means clustering      [0m[1;33m50[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat you should know    [0m[1;33m68[0m
[33m        [0m[33mThe tools you need      [0m[1;33m68[0m
[33m        [0m[33mUsing the exercise files        [0m[1;33m103[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m1[0m[33m. Understanding K-Means Clustering[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is clustering?     [0m[1;33m298[0m[33m     [0m[33mClustering is an unsupervised machine learning approach used to group data based on [0m
[33msimilarity. In this video, learn how to distinguish between some of the common approaches to clustering.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhat is k-means clustering?     [0m[1;33m231[0m[33m     [0m[33mOne of the most popular clustering algorithms is known as k-means clustering. In this [0m
[33mvideo, learn how the k-means clustering algorithm categorizes data using the recursive process of expectation maximization [0m[1;33m([0m[33mEM[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mChoosing the right number of clusters   [0m[1;33m518[0m[33m     [0m[33mThe k-means clustering algorithm requires you specify the number of clusters [0m
[33myou want prior to the learning process. But, what is the best value for k? In this video, learn how several statistical approaches [0m
[33mprovide guidance on what the appropriate number of clusters should be.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mWhy and when to use k-means clustering  [0m[1;33m150[0m[33m     [0m[33mThe k-means clustering algorithm is one of the most popular unsupervised [0m
[33mmachine learning approaches. In this video, learn what types of problems to apply the algorithm to.[0m
[33m## [0m[1;33m2[0m[33m. Segmenting Data with K-Means Clustering[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to segment data with k-means clustering in Python   [0m[1;33m529[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to import, explore, and prepare data [0m
[33mfor clustering; as well as how to segment data using k-means clustering in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to evaluate and visualize clusters in Python        [0m[1;33m233[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to analyze the attributes of clusters[0m
[33mand how to visualize clusters in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to find the right number of clusters in Python      [0m[1;33m297[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to use different statistical [0m
[33mapproaches to determine the appropriate number of clusters to create for a given dataset in Python.[0m
[33m        [0m[33mHow to interpret the results of k-means clustering in Python    [0m[1;33m348[0m[33m     [0m[33mIn this video, learn how to interpret and apply the [0m
[33mresults of k-means clustering in Python.[0m
[33m## Conclusion[0m

[1;33m<[0m[1;33mcourse[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>[0m
[33mProcessing Text with Python Essential Training[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<description>[0m
[33mIn the world of big data, more and more information is consumed and analyzed in text form. Websites, social media, emails, and chats [0m
[33mhave become the key sources for data and insights. If you work with data, then understanding how to deal with unstructured text data [0m
[33mis essential. In this course, instructor Kumaran Ponnambalam helps you build your text mining skill set, covering key techniques for [0m
[33mextracting, cleansing, and processing text in Python. Kumaran reviews key text processing concepts like tokenization and stemming. He [0m
[33malso looks at techniques for converting text into analytics-ready form, including n-grams and TF-IDF. Along the way, he provides [0m
[33mexamples of these techniques using Python and the NLTK library.[0m
[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mdescription[0m[33m>[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36muser:[0m
[33mYou are an L&D administrator at a large enterprise organization, and regularly create curricula for various professional audiences. [0m

[33mHere are some examples of how you map out the audience for a given curriculum:[0m

[33m================================[0m
[33mEXAMPLE: Customer Success curriculum[0m
[1;33m1[0m[33m. Early career people considering a Customer Success career path.[0m
[1;33m2[0m[33m. People currently in customer service roles and who are looking to leverage their skills to move into more specialized customer [0m
[33msuccess positions.[0m
[1;33m3[0m[33m. People in adjacent roles who want/need to embrace a service mindset[0m

[33mEXAMPLE: Javascript curriculum[0m
[33mBeginning web developers or programmers without experience in Javascript[0m

[33mEXAMPLE: Docker curriculum[0m
[33mSofware developers and DevOps Engineers[0m

[33mEXAMPLE: DevOps curriculum[0m
[33mDevOps Engineers, and developer [0m[33m/[0m[33m IT needing a basic understanding of DevOps practices[0m

[33mEXAMPLE: Microservices curriculum[0m
[33mDevelopers and architects who need to skill up on designing, building, and migrating systems to a microservices architecture.[0m

[33mEXAMPLE: C++ curriculum[0m
[33mThis audience is a little different from the Python certificate audience. While Python is a [0m[33m"gateway drug"[0m[33m to programming for a very [0m
[33mwide audience, people who are interested in C++ are likely higher intent to be software developers. As such, this certificate presumes[0m
[33msome basic conversational knowledge with programming, and ramps up more quickly from beginner to advanced topics.[0m
[33mThree personas:[0m
[33m* Beginners who want to start learning C++ programming from scratch and quickly progress to writing their own programs and [0m
[33mapplications.[0m
[33m* Existing C++ programmers who want to take their skills to the next level by mastering more advanced concepts, techniques, and best [0m
[33mpractices.[0m
[33m* Developers coming from other programming languages who need to get up to speed with C++ syntax, fundamentals, and common design [0m
[33mpatterns.[0m

[33mEXAMPLE: Business Skills for Nurses curriculum[0m
[33mNurses who are keen to grow into mgmt positions[0m
[33m================================[0m

[33mLook at this list of course titles and descriptions for a new curriculum:[0m

[33m================================[0m
[33m**Artificial Intelligence Foundations: Machine Learning**: Learn about the machine learning lifecycle and the steps required to build [0m
[33msystems in this hands-on course.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: Foundations**: Learn the basics of machine learning and how you can create a machine learning model [0m
[33mwith Python.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: Decision Trees**: Learn how to build decision trees in Python to measure impurity within a partition [0m
[33mand improve outcomes on machine learning projects.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: Logistic Regression**: Get an introduction to logistic regression by exploring how to build supervised[0m
[33mmachine learning models with Python.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: k-Means Clustering**: Learn the basics of k-means clustering, one of the most popular unsupervised [0m
[33mmachine learning approaches.[0m
[33m**Processing Text with Python Essential Training**: Learn the essential techniques for cleansing and processing text in Python. [0m
[33mDiscover how to convert text to a form that's ready for analytics and predictions.[0m

[33m================================[0m

[33mHow would you describe the audience for this learning path? Your answer should not be longer than [0m[1;33m100[0m[33m words.[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36massistant:[0m
[34m# Machine Learning with Python Curriculum[0m

[34m**Target Audience:**[0m
[34mData scientists, software developers, and analytics professionals who want to build practical machine learning skills using Python. [0m
[34mAlso suitable for:[0m
[34m- Python programmers looking to expand into machine learning[0m
[34m- Data analysts wanting to advance their technical capabilities[0m
[34m- Technical professionals transitioning into AI/ML roles[0m
[34m- Students with basic Python knowledge pursuing data science careers[0m

[34mPrior experience with Python programming basics is recommended, though dedicated beginners with programming experience in other [0m
[34mlanguages could also succeed.[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36muser:[0m
[33mYou are an L&D administrator at a large enterprise organization, and regularly create training programs for various professional [0m
[33maudiences.[0m

[33mHere are some examples of how you create descriptions of your learning programs:[0m

[33m================================[0m
[33mNursing professionals are expected to have both clinical and business skills to succeed in management roles. This learning path [0m
[33mteaches the skills needed to excel in healthcare management: business basics, project management, financial literacy, and how to use [0m
[33mAI tools to enhance productivity. Tune in, pass the final exam, and earn your certificate.[0m

[33mWant to learn what microservices are all about? This architecture pattern helps developers work faster and build more resilient [0m
[33msystems. These courses cover everything from beginner foundations to advanced patterns and refactoring codebases. Tune in, pass the [0m
[33mfinal exam, and earn your professional certificate.[0m

[33mDevOps is not a framework or a workflow. DevOps ensures collaboration and communication between software engineers [0m[1;33m([0m[33mDev[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m and IT [0m
[33moperations [0m[1;33m([0m[33mOps[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m. Whether you are new to DevOps or looking to review the fundamentals, these courses can help. Tune in, pass the final[0m
[33mexam, and earn your certificate.[0m

[33mC++ is renowned for its performance, control, and versatility. Ready to get started? Begin by mastering the fundamentals and then [0m
[33mprogress to proven techniques for writing well-organized, efficient code. By the end, you'll have the knowledge you need to create [0m
[33myour own C++ programs and applications. Tune in, pass the final exam, and earn your professional certificate.[0m

[33mContainers help developers pack up their applications, ensuring they run smoothly anywhere. Software developers need to understand [0m
[33mthese technologies to deliver software as a team. Whether you are new to Docker or looking to review the fundamentals, these courses [0m
[33mcan help. Tune in, pass the final exam, and earn your certificate.[0m

[33mJavaScript is the key to a career in front-end development. These courses equip you with essential skills to master the language, from[0m
[33mfundamental concepts like variables and functions to advanced topics such as asynchronous tasks and DOM scripting. With hands-on [0m
[33mpractice and real-time feedback, you'll gain the expertise needed to excel in web development. Tune in, pass the final exam, and earn [0m
[33myour certificate.[0m
[33m================================[0m

[33mYour team is going to publish a certtificate program titled:[0m
[33mMachine Learning with Python Professional Certificate by Anaconda[0m

[33mNow look at this list of course titles and descriptions for a curriculum:[0m

[33m================================[0m
[33m**Artificial Intelligence Foundations: Machine Learning**: Learn about the machine learning lifecycle and the steps required to build [0m
[33msystems in this hands-on course.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: Foundations**: Learn the basics of machine learning and how you can create a machine learning model [0m
[33mwith Python.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: Decision Trees**: Learn how to build decision trees in Python to measure impurity within a partition [0m
[33mand improve outcomes on machine learning projects.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: Logistic Regression**: Get an introduction to logistic regression by exploring how to build supervised[0m
[33mmachine learning models with Python.[0m
[33m**Machine Learning with Python: k-Means Clustering**: Learn the basics of k-means clustering, one of the most popular unsupervised [0m
[33mmachine learning approaches.[0m
[33m**Processing Text with Python Essential Training**: Learn the essential techniques for cleansing and processing text in Python. [0m
[33mDiscover how to convert text to a form that's ready for analytics and predictions.[0m

[33m================================[0m

[33mHow would you describe this learning path? Structure your answer like the examples given above, and use this overall pattern:[0m

[1;33m1[0m[33m. **Introduction**: Introduce the topic or subject matter.[0m
[1;33m2[0m[33m. **Value Proposition**: Highlight the benefits or outcomes of engaging with the content.[0m
[1;33m3[0m[33m. **Course Overview**: Provide a brief overview of what the courses cover or what skills will be learned.[0m
[1;33m4[0m[33m. **Call to Action**: The final sentence should always be [0m[33m"Tune in, pass the final exam, and earn your certificate."[0m

[33mThe length of your answer should be between [0m[1;33m40[0m[33m and [0m[1;33m60[0m[33m words.[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36massistant:[0m
[34mMachine learning with Python is one of today's most in-demand technical skills. This certificate program teaches you the complete ML [0m
[34mworkflowâ€”from data preparation and model building to implementing decision trees, logistic regression, and k-means clustering. You'll [0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36massistant:[0m
[1;34m1[0m[34m. Discover the machine learning lifecycle and modeling steps.[0m
[1;34m2[0m[34m. Create machine learning models using Python.[0m
[1;34m3[0m[34m. Analyze different approaches like decision trees and k-means.[0m
[1;34m4[0m[34m. Practice processing text data for analytics in Python.[0m

[1;32mâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€ [0mMessage[1;32m â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€[0m
[1;36muser:[0m
[33mThe following is a description of a professional certificate program that my company is going to publish:[0m

[33m================================[0m
[33mMachine learning with Python is one of today's most in-demand technical skills. This certificate program teaches you the complete ML [0m
[33mworkflowâ€”from data preparation and model building to implementing decision trees, logistic regression, and k-means clustering. You'll [0m
[33mgain practical skills for real-world AI applications using Python. Tune in, pass the final exam, and earn your certificate.[0m
[33m================================[0m

[33mThis is the title of the program: Machine Learning with Python Professional Certificate by Anaconda[0m

[33mWrite a short congratulatory message that I can send to my colleagues to announce this partnership. [0m

[33mStart with: [0m[33m"[0m[33m[[0m[33mPartner[0m[33m][0m[33m has signed for a [0m[33m!"[0m
[33mThen a description of why the topic is important.[0m
[33mThen a description of why the Partner is such a good fit for this topic.[0m
[33mAnnouncement should be one paragraph, [0m[1;33m40[0m[33m-[0m[1;33m70[0m[33m words long.[0m

[33mUse the following example announcements as context for this task.[0m

[33m================================[0m
[33mArista Networks has signed for a Network Automation Professional Certificate! Arista is the industry leader in cloud networking for [0m
[33mlarge data center, campus and routing environments [0m[1;33m([0m[33m$90bn market cap[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m and is the primary networking services provider for big tech [0m
[33mcompanies like Microsoft and Meta. [0m

[33m<course_title>Learning SQL Programming<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Structured Query Language [0m[1;33m([0m[33mSQL[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m is a common tool for retrieving data from relational databases such as SQL Server, [0m
[33mMySQL, MariaDB, and PostgreSQL. This course provides an introduction to this core programming language. Learn how to request data from a [0m
[33mdatabase, limit and sort the responses, aggregate data from multiple tables with joins, and edit and delete data. Instructor Scott [0m
[33mSimpson also shows how to perform simple math operations and transform data into different formats.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Advanced SQL for Application Development<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Many applications require a relational database. But poorly designed data architecture and poorly written SQL can [0m
[33mresult in subpar performance, unreliable services, and difficulty scaling. This course includes hands-on examples and lessons that show [0m
[33mhow to build scalable and resilient databases to support any application. Learn how to write optimized SQL for transaction processing, [0m
[33muse indexes to reduce read latency, partition data to improve scalability, and use established design patterns. Instructor Dan Sullivan [0m
[33malso explores object relational mapping and shows how to respond to database errors such as query timeouts and refused connections. After[0m
[33mcompleting this course, you will be able to design robust database applications that can scale to meet increasingly demanding [0m
[33mworkloads.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Database Foundations: Data Structures<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>&lt;p&gt;This course focuses on seven core concepts: data types, designing a normalized database, identifying rows [0m
[33mwith primary keys, linking data with foreign keys, formalizing data relationships, indexes, and constraints. Database expert Adam Wilbert[0m
[33mdescribes techniques that database developers use to protect their data. He explains why data types are important in creating a [0m
[33mconsistent data storage environment, then walks you through several common data types. Adam shows you the three normal forms of good [0m
[33mdatabase design.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;Adam steps you through how to incorporate primary keys and foreign keys into the design of your [0m
[33mdatabase tables. He walks through data relationships, indexes, and constraints, then concludes with other courses you may find [0m
[33museful.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;You can practice what you learn with a series of code challenges and solutions.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Data Analysis: Investigate with SQL<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>&lt;p&gt;Are you looking to enhance your skills in data analysis and become a valuable asset in today's data-driven [0m
[33mbusiness world? Learning SQL, the widely used language for managing relational databases, can be a game changer for [0m
[33myou.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;In this course, you will learn the fundamental skills needed to navigate and analyze data effectively. Discover [0m
[33mthe basic structure of relational databases, how they work, and their importance to businesses. You'll also explore the top SQL queries, [0m
[33mincluding the WHERE clause and operators such as IN, BETWEEN, AND, and OR, and how and when to use them for efficient data analysis. By [0m
[33mthe end of the course, you'll have the knowledge and skills to access, warehouse, and analyze data efficiently. You'll be able to make [0m
[33mbetter decisions and gain valuable insights into the data that matters most. Don't miss out on the chance to enhance your skills and [0m
[33mbecome a valuable asset in today's data-driven world.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>SQL Server Fundamentals: Master Basic Query Techniques<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Do you want to learn about SQL but arenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t sure where to start? In this beginner-level course, instructor Julianne [0m
[33mThouin covers basic concepts of relational database design and explains how to write simple SELECT statements using joins and proper [0m
[33mfiltering. Julianne explains what SQL Server is and what it is used for. Next, she shows how tables in a relational database relate to [0m
[33mone another through surrogate, primary, and foreign keys. Julianne teaches you how to tackle the most basic query possible. She explains [0m
[33mhow AND and OR logic applies to filtering queries on more than one data point, then discusses INNER joins and OUTER joins. Julianne [0m
[33mcovers how to use subqueries for filtering your results. She walks you through some commonly used examples of built-in functions. In [0m
[33mconclusion, Julianne shows you how aggregate functions work using the GROUP BY and HAVING clauses.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Querying Microsoft SQL Server [0m[1;33m2019[0m[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Discover how to query data from SQL Server tables. In this course, Adam Wilbert covers how to retrieve information [0m
[33mstored in a Microsoft SQL Server database using the Transact-SQL [0m[1;33m([0m[33mT-SQL[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m language. Learn the fundamental structure of a query and see how[0m
[33mto manipulate data through the use of built-in functions, operators, filters, and other language features to return a dataset that's [0m
[33mformatted to meet a wide variety of needs and perspectives. Upon wrapping up this course, you'll be equipped with the commands and [0m
[33mkeywords you need to know to effectively analyze your data.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Advanced SQL for Data Scientists<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Many data scientists know how to work with SQLÃ¢â‚¬â€the industry-standard language for data analysis. But as data sizes [0m
[33mgrow, you need to know how to do more than simply read and write from a database. This course provides a more sophisticated approach to [0m
[33mdesigning data models and optimizing queries in SQL. Instructor Dan Sullivan begins with the logical and physical design of tablesÃ¢â‚¬â€with[0m
[33mparticular focus on very large databasesÃ¢â‚¬â€and then presents a deep dive review of indexes, including specialized indexes and when to use[0m
[33mthem. The next section introduces query optimization and shows how to optimize basic, multi-join, and more complex queries. The course [0m
[33malso covers SQL extensions, including user-defined functions and specialized data types. The techniques taught here enable more efficient[0m
[33manalysis of large data sets using SQL, statistics, and custom business logic.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>SQL Practice: Basic Queries<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>In this hands-on, interactive course, join instructor David Gassner to practice writing basic queries in SQL, the [0m
[33mpopular programming language thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s widely used for relational databases. This course includes Code Challenges powered by CoderPad. [0m
[33mCode Challenges are interactive coding exercises with real-time feedback, so you can get hands-on coding practice to advance your coding [0m
[33mskills. David helps you boost your skills as a SQL programmer with seven specific, query-focused coding challenges. Practice retrieving [0m
[33msorted data from a specific table or multiple tables, retrieving data filtered on a range of values, retrieving aggregated data with SQL [0m
[33mfunctions, retrieving data filtered with a string pattern, and more.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>SQL for Non-Programmers<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>&lt;p&gt;New technologies allow data to be shared, accessed, and analyzed more easily than ever before, even by [0m
[33mnon-data science professionals. Regardless of your industry, technical background, or current role, you can now leverage data to make [0m
[33mbetter business decisions with the easy-to-use SQL Data Query Language. This course covers some of the most basic, fundamental SQL [0m
[33mcommands for non-programmers and non-data science professionals.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;Join instructor Christina Stathopoulos as she [0m
[33mdemonstrates the skills required to independently and confidently access and analyze your data, utilizing key commands, functions, and [0m
[33mjoins such as SELECT, ORDER BY, WHERE, GROUP BY, HAVING, CASE, wildcards, UNION, and more. Along the way, test out your new skills in the[0m
[33mexercise challenges at the end of each section.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Querying Microsoft SQL Server [0m[1;33m2022[0m[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Want to learn more about how to query data from SQL Server tables? In this course, instructor Adam Wilbert covers how[0m
[33mto retrieve information stored in a Microsoft SQL Server database using the Transact-SQL [0m[1;33m([0m[33mT-SQL[0m[1;33m)[0m[33m language and the updated features of SQL[0m
[33mServer [0m[1;33m2022[0m[33m.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;Learn the fundamental structure of a successful query, from ideation to execution. Find out how to [0m
[33mmanipulate data through the use of built-in functions, operators, filters, and other language features to return a data set, ensuring [0m
[33mthat itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s properly formatted and applicable to a wide variety of needs and perspectives. Along the way, Adam gives you tips and [0m
[33mpointers on how to get the most out of your queries. Upon completing this course, you'll be equipped with the commands and keywords you [0m
[33mneed to know to analyze your data more effectively.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>PostgreSQL: Advanced Queries<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>In this course, database expert Adam Wilbert introduces you to a number of advanced query techniques that you can use[0m
[33mto better understand your data. Statistical analyses involve understanding the shape and size of the full data set, and deeper insights [0m
[33mcan be gained by grouping data together to obtain some very useful metrics. Adam shows you how to create basic groups and apply aggregate[0m
[33mcalculations, then moves into window functions that create subgroups for more granular analysis. He goes over statistics that are based [0m
[33mon sorted data within groups, such as the median value, the first and third quartiles of a dataset, the most frequent value, and more. [0m
[33mAdam also covers ranking, hypothetical sets, percentile functions, and conditional expressions for further manipulating query result [0m
[33msets. He concludes with some additional querying techniques that you may find useful in solving common problems.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Advanced SQL for Data Scientists<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Many data scientists know how to work with SQLÃ¢â‚¬â€the industry-standard language for data analysis. But as data sizes [0m
[33mgrow, you need to know how to do more than simply read and write from a database. This course provides a more sophisticated approach to [0m
[33mdesigning data models and optimizing queries in SQL. Instructor Dan Sullivan begins with the logical and physical design of tablesÃ¢â‚¬â€with[0m
[33mparticular focus on very large databasesÃ¢â‚¬â€and then presents a deep dive review of indexes, including specialized indexes and when to use[0m
[33mthem. The next section introduces query optimization and shows how to optimize basic, multi-join, and more complex queries. The course [0m
[33malso covers SQL extensions, including user-defined functions and specialized data types. The techniques taught here enable more efficient[0m
[33manalysis of large data sets using SQL, statistics, and custom business logic.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m

[33mwith built-in functions, all while offering challenges that help you master the material. Find out how to identify top performers, [0m
[33mautomate repetitive analysis tasks, make queries more flexible with parameter requests, and increase accuracy and consistency in your [0m
[33mdatabase using program flow functions. Adam closes with an assortment of useful query tricks. Take the challenges posed along the way to [0m
[33mtest and practice your new Access skills.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m

[33m<course_title>Advanced SQL: Logical Query Processing, Part [0m[1;33m1[0m[33m<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>SQL has been the dominant data processing language for the past five decades. This course takes you beyond the syntax[0m
[33mfundamentals, and into a new world of understanding how relational database management systems process SQL queries, and how that impacts [0m
[33myour coding practices. Learn about logical query processing, and avoid most common pitfalls and processing limitations. Discover advanced[0m
[33mJOIN techniques and how to deal with missing data. Understand the subtleties of ternary logic, SELECT expression evaluation, grouping [0m
[33mlogic, and how to implement efficient paging and ordering. By the end of the course, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be able to take advantage of the nuances of[0m
[33mlogical query processing to easily troubleshoot and solve daunting SQL challenges elegantly and efficiently.&lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;This [0m
[33mcourse was created by Ami Levin. We are pleased to offer this training in our library.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m

[33m<course_title>Advanced  SQL Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Window Functions<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>&lt;p&gt;Window functions are one of the most radical, fundamental enhancements to modern SQL. They allow access to [0m
[33mneighboring rows without using subqueries, thus enabling amazing opportunities for concise, elegant, high-performing [0m
[33msolutions.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;This course teaches the foundations and intricacies of window function processing and how to use it to [0m
[33mimplement practical solutions to everyday challenges. You can learn how to use different constructs and advanced solution techniques and [0m
[33mhow to utilize the declarative and composable nature of SQL and its processing order. By the end of the course youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll better understand[0m
[33mthe fundamental pros and cons of each method.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;This course was created by Ami Levin. We are pleased to offer this training in our[0m
[33mlibrary.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m

[33m<course_description>&lt;p&gt;Relational databases are often used to manage large scale volumes of data so developers and data modelers [0m
[33mneed to understand scalable  architecture and data modeling patterns. &lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;&lt;p&gt;In this course, Dan SullivanÃ¢â‚¬â€a data  [0m
[33marchitect, data modeler and data scientist with decades of experience Ã¢â‚¬â€begins with scalability requirements, particularly business [0m
[33mrequirements, data volumes and data growth. Next,  the course moves on to examine database architecture and data modeling patterns [0m
[33mfollowed by an in depth look at supporting scalable data ingestion. Querying, of course, is a crucial component of any database [0m
[33marchitecture. Learn about the differences between transactional and analytical queries and how we can use database resources like indexes[0m
[33mand materialized views for improving performance. The course concludes with a discussion of DevOps for scalable relational databases so [0m
[33mwe can keep our databases performant and operating as expected.&lt;[0m[33m/[0m[33mp[0m[33m&gt;<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_title>Advanced SQL for Application Development<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_title[0m[33m>[0m
[33m<course_description>Many applications require a relational database. But poorly designed data architecture and poorly written SQL can [0m
[33mresult in subpar performance, unreliable services, and difficulty scaling. This course includes hands-on examples and lessons that show [0m
[33mhow to build scalable and resilient databases to support any application. Learn how to write optimized SQL for transaction processing, [0m
[33muse indexes to reduce read latency, partition data to improve scalability, and use established design patterns. Instructor Dan Sullivan [0m
[33malso explores object relational mapping and shows how to respond to database errors such as query timeouts and refused connections. After[0m
[33mcompleting this course, you will be able to design robust database applications that can scale to meet increasingly demanding [0m
[33mworkloads.<[0m[33m/[0m[33mcourse_description[0m[33m>[0m
